author: achapman
title: Manchester United transfer news: James Rodriguez staying at Real Madrid in January despite Red Devils making enquiry
text:
No Deal Manchester United transfer news: James Rodriguez staying at Real Madrid in January despite Red Devils making enquiry 
Spanish giants have no intention of parting ways with Colombian superstar and are unable to sign replacement By ANTHONY CHAPMAN Comments JAMES RODRIGUEZ will not be leaving Real Madrid in January, it has been claimed. 
The disgruntled midfielder has been strongly linked with a move to Manchester United after airing his grievances last month. AP:Associated Press 4 James Rodriguez will not be leaving Real Madrid in January 
SunSport exclusively revealed on Monday that United have already made an enquiry ahead of the summer transfer window, with Real demanding a whopping £50million. Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And Spanish football Guillem Balague has now confirmed that Rodriguez will indeed be staying put for the meantime, with Real unable to sign a replacement until the end of the season due to a transfer ban. 
He tweeted: “James said in December he was considering his future. No offers arrived for him and Real want him to stay till end of the season at least.” James said in December he was considering his future. No offers arrived for him and Real want him to stay till end of the season at least 
— Guillem Balague (@GuillemBalague) January 4, 2017 Manchester United, West Brom and Burnley all involved in goal-line decisions Reuters 4 Man Utd have made an enquiry to sign the playmaker next summer 
The Red Devils gaffer has been linked with a stunning double swoop for Atletico Madrid pair Antoine Griezmann and Saul Niguez. Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport's daily LIVE blog Related Stories All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window One Morr Time Ex-Man United starlet Ravel Morrison could make sensational return to English football with Wigan We are ten years behind united Pep claims City need a decade at the top in Europe to catch up with their local rivals RED AND BURY-D? Man United and rivals City track Bury wonderkids Jordan Bedeau, 17, and 16-year-old Callum Styles Getty Images Antoine Griezmann has been linked with an Old Trafford move Getty Images
